what: Post Doctoral Associate
where: Department of Biochemistry and Microbiology, Rutgers University
additional_info: Supervisor: Distinguished Professor Debashish Bhattacharya. Project focuses on using integrated multi-omics data to study plastid evolution and endosymbiosis in the photosynthetic amoeba *Paulinella*.

what: Undergraduate Research Project
where: Institute for Molecular Bioscience, The University of Queensland
additional_info: Supervisor: Dr Ann-Marie Patch. Focused on understanding cancer genome morphology through analysis of next generation sequencing data.

what: Paid Research Assistant
where: School of Biological Sciences, The University of Queensland
additional_info: Supervisors: Associate Professor Sandie Degnan, Dr Selene Fernandez Valverde, and Simone Higgie. Duties included developing a computational pipeline for detection of lateral genetic transfer in marine sponge.

what: Undergraduate Researcher Project
where: School of Biological Sciences, The University of Queensland
additional_info: Supervisors: Associate Professor Sandie Degnan and Simone Higgie. Project focused on using phylogenetics to define the origin of conserved protein domains identified as potentially having arisen via lateral genetic transfer in marine sponge.

what: Honours Project
where: Institute for Molecular Bioscience, The University of Queensland
additional_info: Supervisors: Professor Mark Ragan and Dr Cheong Xin Chan. Project focuses on using next generation sequencing data to define a set of core *Symbiodinium* genes vital to the maintenance of coral-dinoflagellate symbiosis.

what: PhD
where: Institute for Molecular Bioscience, The University of Queensland
additional_info: Supervisors: Professor Mark Ragan and Dr Cheong Xin Chan. Project focuses on using next generation sequencing data to study the genome evolution of dinoflagellate algae, with a focus on the lineage associated with coral symbiosis.

what: Post Doctoral Associate
where: Department of Biochemistry and Microbiology, Rutgers University
additional_info: Supervisor: Distinguished Professor Debashish Bhattacharya. Project focuses on using integrated multi-omics data to study plastid evolution and endosymbiosis in the photosynthetic amoeba *Paulinella*.

what: CASPiE Tutor
additional_info: Duties included guiding undergraduate chemistry students through an advanced set of research-focused practicals, with the aim of developing their critical and experimental thinking.

what: Science Mentor
additional_info: Duties included organizing and running first year science student introduction and social engagement events designed to inform students about study/research opportunities available at The University of Queensland.

what: Peer Assisted Study Session (PASS) Tutor
additional_info: Duties included planning and leading multiple weekly tutorial sessions, each comprising 20-30+ students.

what: Practical Tutor

what: Head Practical Tutor
additional_info: Duties included designing and developing assessment material for the course and organising marking of assignments.

what: Guest lecturer
additional_info: Design and conducted lectures on de novo next-generation genome and transcriptome sequencing, metabolomics, proteomics, metagenomics, phylogenetics, and phylogenomics in a join undergraduate and postgraduate course titled "Fundamentals of Microbial Genomics". Duties include designing and marking student' exam questions and oral presentations.

what: Our paper Amoeba Genome Reveals Dominant Host Contribution to Plastid Endosymbiosis covered by Rutgers Today
Our paper Why is primary endosymbiosis so rare? was covered by Rutgers Newsroom. We also produced two animated videos: Video 1, Video 2

A Fast, Flexible Tool for Sorting Phylogenetic Trees
additional_info: Screens and sorts phylogenetic trees in both traditional and extended Newick format. Allows for the fast and flexible screening (within a tree) of Exclusive clades that comprise only the target taxa and/or Non- Exclusive clades that includes a defined portion of non-target taxa.

what: Dinoflagellate Annotation Workflow
additional_info: a workflow for the prediction of protein-coding genes in dinoflagellate genomes. It integrates evidence from multiple sources, including transcriptome, proteome, and other ab initio gene prediction tools.
